description: Erection of single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The proposed erection of single storey rear extension falls within the parameters of  permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Classes A & G of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Consultations no surrounding properties were notified  of the proposed development.  1 letter of  representation received which was neutral in content relating to the use of the outbuilding to be incidental to the main dwelling.Proposal The application seeks full planning permission for  (Retrospective) Demolition of existing detached garage and erection of single story rear outbuilding.  Application SiteThe  site comprises  a semi detached dwelling. Planning History24/01631/HOU - Erection of first floor side and part first floor rear extension. Refused 01.09.24Planning Assessment  The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.- Fire Safety DesignPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should enhance local context by delivering buildings and spaces that positively respond to local distinctiveness through their layout, orientation, scale, appearance and shape, with due regard to existing and emerging street hierarchy, building types, forms and proportions.Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance in the Council's Residential Design Guide SPD 2013 require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer comment : The proposal seeks retrospective approval for the demolition of existing detached garage and erection of single storey rear outbuilding. The original outbuilding projected a  depth of 6.622m and maximum width 3.031m with a flat roof height 2.726m.Irregular in built footprint, the proposed outbuilding  which has been  constructed would be positioned 1m from the main dwelling and would project a  maximum depth of 10.186m and maximum width of 4.526m.  It would have a flat roof with an eaves height 2.5m.  A proposed door and fenestration would only be presented on the proposed side elevation 1  facing into the garden.

Proposal Confirmation - We query the proposal description because it only refers to the Change of Use, but the plans indicate a proposed new front entrance, and changes to the East elevation facade affecting all floors. In addition, the proposal is stated as Use Class "E(a)" which is for retail sale of goods, when you are proposing the sale of food and drink (Use Class E(b)). As the description must describe all changes as shown on plan, as well as the correct Use Class proposed, please confirm the full proposal description and amend plans if necessary.
